triples.name: Network science
triples.relevance: The foundational field that provides theoretical framework for studying networks as complex systems.

triples.name: Complex system
triples.relevance: The core subject of study, representing systems with multiple interacting components exhibiting emergent behavior.

triples.name: Synchronization
triples.relevance: A key dynamical process studied on higher-order networks where coupled oscillators coordinate their behavior.

triples.name: Epidemic
triples.relevance: Models contagion processes on networks, including disease spread and information diffusion.

triples.name: Co-operation (evolution)
triples.relevance: Addresses the evolution of cooperative behavior in multi-agent systems on networks.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: Studies how agents on networks reach agreement through local interactions and information exchange.
